page.title: 11Flitton Parish Church
page.content:
The church stands on a rise in the centre of the original village and was built about 500 years ago. It was constructed of local sandstone and, unlike many village churches, was not extended piecemeal.
The one main addition was the Grey family chapel, built for the tombs of the owners of Wrest Park in nearby Silsoe. The chapel contains a number of monuments, the earliest dating from the 16th Century.
The medieval screen, glass and pulpit have been removed but there is still much that is interesting.
The dedication is to St.John the Baptist.
